will say you get stuck in Galveston and
getting stuck in Galveston means having

Priscilla Gonzalez Culver coordinates a
college readiness program for high

target students that are potential

their parents have not received a
bachelor's degree yet they have to

she helped in helico through the

another key factor is changing family
structures among poorer households her
father wasn't really involved too much

not having an another person to help

they're obligated to stay in help
whether it be working to help out

and helico was accepted by Emory
University in Atlanta one of the

worried because you know find out

helices mother makes just over $30,000 a

earning less than fifty thousand the

students can avoid taking out loans I
was so happy to be there this is amazing
the dorm is amazing everything is so
pretty I was just excited to see how it
all was gonna go but things did not

because she did not have her father's

register with it and
there wasn't anything to do the best
thing I could do was to get either
parent loan or a student loan private
student loan she did not tell her mother
I'm not gonna go and bring this extra
stress home that she can't even do
anything about instead she asked the men
she was dating fred to co-sign a $40,000
private loan
he agreed her first year she was able to
earn A's and B's in some of her classes
but the need to earn money made it
difficult to keep up I would enjoy the
subject matter but a lot of times
reading the chapters that were necessary
wouldn't always get done when her second
year rolled around Emory mistakenly
thought and helico had underreported her
family's income and therefore reduced
her aide without telling her and helicam
moved off campus and worked more hours
to make up the difference
her grades suffered I even went to
Emory's psychologist trying to see if I
could meet with one of you know
counselors or something and and they're
like oh it'd only be like a $10 charge
for each session well the reason I
didn't do it was like you know I
couldn't spare the extra ten dollars so
I was still stuck with dealing with it
by the start of her senior year the
former High School standout had gotten
depressed and distracted by her
financial problems she was skipping
classes and failing most of her courses
with less than a year to go and helico
was eventually suspended and she
returned to Galveston now she works
full-time and makes 850 an hour in the
furniture store owned by Fred's parents
she also takes classes at the Community
College in part to defer the $60,000 she
